args: Whew! That was one exhausting journey.\nGood thing I've got a bed in the castle\nwith my name on it.
I hear you. Let's hurry up and get back.
It smells like something is burning.\n...Ah! Look there! Smoke!
There's a village over there, right?
Yeah, that one we used to trade with\nback in the day. Please tell me it's\nnot actually on fire!
We'd better go check it out.
Could it be the work of fire-breathing\nfiends, perhaps?
This ain't fiends. Look here—these prints\nare from military-issue boots.
Look! There's someone on the ground!
Easy, now. Let me heal you.
The Empire—they swept through without\nmercy. What did we ever do to them?!
They did the same to our own\nvillage some time back.
And we're seeing similar things\nhappening all over the continent now.
I'll never forgive them for this...\nI've got to take down the Empire!
Takin' on fiends and takin' on the\nentire Empire are two very different things.
How? They're both just strong foes.
Think about it for just a minute.\n...The answer's right in front of ya.
Elisanne! Luca! You two move the rubble!\nWe're going to save the people trapped\nundeneath!
On it!\n...We're here to help!\nAnswer if you can hear us!
Cleo, you heal the wounded.\nTry to prioritize the most heavily injured.
Is this what you were talking about when\nyou said there's a difference between\nfighting the Empire and fighting fiends?
Yep. When ya fight a fiend, ya just gotta\nfocus on what's in front of ya.

But the Empire's bigger than any pack'a
fiends. Even if ya beat the guy in front,
yer gonna lose other battles somewhere
down the line.

For example, ya gotta go back to places
where ya lost and take care of who's left.
If ya do that, maybe they turn into allies
what can help out later on.
The prince knows that better'n anyone.
Ranzal, can you give me a hand?\nWe need to fashion some temporary\nhuts for these people to live in.
He's taking the time to build huts?
I never would have thought of that...\nIf it was up to me, we'd just be chasing\ndown the soldiers who did this.
This must be what Ranzal meant\nwhen he talked about ＂the big picture.＂
The prince wants to earn victory for\neveryone—with the HELP of everyone!
There might still be others who need our\nhelp; we have to save them all if we can.
You're going to be all right.\nYour mom is in that hut there.
Oh, thank goodness you're all right!
How can I possibly thank you for\nsaving my child?
I know you two have been through a lot,\nbut everything is going to be all right.
Let's get back to looking, Sarisse.
Look at all the people you're saving,\n{player_name}! It's amazing!
I'm just a very small part of this.
Without all of you at my side,\nnone of it would be possible.
There's just something about you that\nmakes others WANT to help you.
I know, because I feel it myself.
That's a special quality—there are very\nfew people who have it.
I'm honored that you think so. Thank you.
Yep! You're one in a million for sure.
I wonder if I'll ever be like you?
I just thought of something!\nSomething great!
Oh? Glad to hear it.\nNow, let's help those people!
Attention, villagers! We're here to help,\nand we won't leave until the last one\nof you is safe!
(I think I've finally found the path I should\nbe following...)
(If I make the prince my role model...)
(I should be able to find my own dream!)
